intro: Heterocentron occidentale, commonly known as the western starflower, is a herbaceous plant native to the western regions of North America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant has opposite, narrow leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along streambanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
